cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.category: Category 2 (105-110 mph, forecast to reach major-hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then expected to slow and meander near or just inland of the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle Texas coast from Port Mansfield through Corpus Christi to Sargent, extending northeast toward High Island
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possibly 115–120 mph) are likely at Corpus Christi beginning Friday night and persisting into Saturday as the core crosses the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 6–12 ft above ground predicted from the Padre Island National Seashore through Sargent, encompassing Corpus Christi Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Catastrophic rainfall totals of 15–25 inches with isolated 35 inches expected, producing severe fresh-water flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, a few tornadoes in outer rainbands, prolonged port closure risk due to meandering storm.
